blocks.value: St. Tarcisius was a young boy who lived in Rome during the 3rd century, a time of severe persecution of Christians. He served as an acolyte and was entrusted with carrying the Blessed Sacrament to Christians who were in prison awaiting martyrdom.

One day, while carrying the Eucharist, Tarcisius was stopped by a group of pagan boys who demanded to see what he was carrying. Tarcisius refused to surrender the Blessed Sacrament. The boys attacked and stoned him to death. When his body was recovered, the Eucharist was no longer with him, believed to have been miraculously taken to safety. St. Tarcisius is the patron saint of altar servers and First Communicants.
